TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen of NORP origin , born in DATE . He resides at GPE , GPE . Before the ORG he is represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON of ORG .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is the majority shareholder of CARDINAL limited companies in GPE , both trading with various forms of clothing . In DATE the police investigated certain economic transactions between companies in GPE and GPE and it appeared that the applicant was involved in those transactions . As the applicant was suspected of having violated i.a . the tax legislation , it was decided to carry out a search . The search took place on DATE in the LOC of CARDINAL of the companies and the applicant ’s home . After the search the applicant was questioned by the police and provisionally charged ( sigtet ) with aggravated tax evasion under LAW of LAW ( straffeloven ) and LAW , subsection CARDINAL , of LAW ( skattekontrolloven ) in an amount exceeding MONEY ( ORG ) .

In DATE the police carried out an investigation of the applicant ’s economic transactions and questioned a number of persons . At the same time the tax authorities carried out an investigation of the tax assessments for DATE concerning the applicant and CARDINAL of his companies . An extensive auditor ’s report was issued on DATE by ORG ( PERSON ) . On DATE a meeting was held between ORG and the applicant assisted by his lawyer and accountant . The applicant largely disagreed with the findings in the report . Decisions on tax increases concerning the applicant personally and the company were made in accordance with the report , and in DATE they appealed to ORG ( skatteankenævnet ) of respectively PERSON and GPE .
On DATE ORG requested ORG ( Told- og PERSON ) to have criminal charges brought against the applicant for aggravated tax evasion .
On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the consideration of his appeal would await the outcome of the appeal made by the company to ORG .

In a letter of DATE ORG B , ( GPE , PERSON ) informed ORG that further investigations concerning the criminal charge against the applicant would await the decision of ORG . On DATE the ORG requested the police to advance the criminal charge against the applicant as the tax assessment to a large extent depended on questions of evidence . On CARDINAL DATE the police insisted , however , that the tax appeal case be decided first . The applicant was informed of this decision on DATE .

On DATE ORG decided the appeal made by the applicant ’s company . ORG found that during DATE the company had evaded CARDINAL ORG . ORG considered that the outcome of the case to a large extent depended on questions of evidence .
On DATE the company appealed against the decision to ORG ) .

On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the consideration of his appeal would await the outcome of the company ’s appeal to ORG , but that he was entitled to bring the complaint about the tax increases concerning him before ORG without awaiting the decision of ORG . The applicant apparently did not make use of this possibility .

In letters of CARDINAL DATE to ORG and ORG the applicant ’s present lawyer complained about the length of the criminal proceedings against the applicant and requested that they be speeded up and the case pending before ORG be suspended awaiting the outcome of the criminal charge . The request was , however , rejected by the authorities . A similar request in a letter of DATE to ORG was likewise rejected .

On DATE ORG upheld the decision of CARDINAL DATE by ORG . At that time the applicant ’s complaint against his personal tax increase was still pending and the criminal charge against him was still under investigation by the police .

On DATE the applicant was informed that the criminal charges against him were dropped . The reason therefor was that a continuation of the case appeared to involve difficulties , costs or processing time which would not be proportionate to the importance of the case and the sentence which could be imposed in case of conviction .

On DATE the applicant submitted a request for damages pursuant to chapter CARDINALa of ORG ( retsplejeloven ) to ORG ( Statsadvokaten ) . He referred , inter alia , to the length of the proceedings and to LAW . On DATE ORG rejected the claim as it had been submitted out of time .

On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision to ORG PERSON ) referring to LAW a of ORG and maintaining that the delays in submitting his claims were excusable . On DATE the Prosecutor General agreed with the applicant and referred the case back to ORG for a determination on its merits . The case is at present pending there .
B. Relevant domestic law

Section CARDINAL a § CARDINAL , first sentence , of ORG provides that any person who has been arrested or remanded in custody as part of criminal prosecution is entitled to damages for the tort so inflicted if the charge is withdrawn or the accused is acquitted except where the acquittal is due to the fact that the person was not accountable for his / her actions .

Under the same rules as stated in section DATE a , damages may be awarded to a provisionally charged ( sigtet ) person who has been subjected to other criminal procedural interventions as part of the criminal prosecution , cf . section CARDINAL b of ORG .
ORG decides claims for damages pursuant to sections DATE a to d of ORG , cf . section CARDINAL e § CARDINAL , first sentence , of the LAW .

Claims from a person who has been provisionally charged must be made within DATE of notice to the person so charged that the charge has been withdrawn or of pronouncement of a final judgment , cf . section CARDINAL e § CARDINAL , third sentence , of ORG .

Where the claim is made after expiry of the deadline referred to in section CARDINAL e § CARDINAL , the claim can be considered provided that it is found excusable for the person to exceed the deadline , cf . section CARDINAL e § CARDINAL of ORG .
The Prosecutor General considers appeals against decisions made by ORG concerning claims for damages , cf . section CARDINAL e § CARDINAL , first sentence .
Where the claim for damages is dismissed , the claimant may demand the claim brought before the courts , cf . section CARDINAL f of ORG .

Claims for damages raised on the basis of the general rules on damages under NORP law by the person charged or convicted , or by others subject to criminal prosecution , are considered , upon request , in accordance with the rules in chapter CARDINAL a , cf . section CARDINAL h of ORG .
